intro: Myrioneuron pubescens, commonly known as the hairy myrioneuron, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its stems are often covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its common name. Myrioneuron pubescens is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
